unnormalised: AICTE announces free online LaTeX workshops for engineering students!
normalised: A-I-C-T-E announces free online L-a-T-e-X workshops for engineering students!

unnormalised: The All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) has announced a series of free online workshops focused on LaTeX, a document preparation system widely used in academia and research, particularly in mathematics, computer science, and engineering. The workshops are designed to equip students with the skills necessary to produce high-quality technical documents, including research papers, theses, and project reports. The first workshop will be held on 20/07/2024, at 10:00 AM IST, with registration closing on 15/07/2024.
normalised: The All India Council for Technical Education (A-I-C-T-E) has announced a series of free online workshops focused on L-a-T-e-X, a document preparation system widely used in academia and research, particularly in mathematics, computer science, and engineering. The workshops are designed to equip students with the skills necessary to produce high-quality technical documents, including research papers, theses, and project reports. The first workshop will be held on twentieth july two thousand and twenty four, at ten A-M I-S-T, with registration closing on fifteenth july two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: LaTeX is known for its ability to handle complex mathematical formulas and equations with ease. For instance, expressing the quadratic formula using LaTeX involves commands like: $x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}$. Participants will learn how to use these commands and other formatting tools to create professional-looking documents that meet the standards of leading academic journals and conferences. The workshops will cover topics ranging from basic LaTeX syntax to more advanced features such as creating tables, figures, and bibliographies. Special attention will be given to producing documents using the standard article class, with examples of common mathematical notation such as $\int_{0}^{\infty} e^{-x^2} dx = \frac{\sqrt{\pi}}{2}$.
normalised: L-a-T-e-X is known for its ability to handle complex mathematical formulas and equations with ease. For instance, expressing the quadratic formula using L-a-T-e-X involves commands like: x equals minus b plus or minus the square root of b squared minus four a c all divided by two a. Participants will learn how to use these commands and other formatting tools to create professional-looking documents that meet the standards of leading academic journals and conferences. The workshops will cover topics ranging from basic L-a-T-e-X syntax to more advanced features such as creating tables, figures, and bibliographies. Special attention will be given to producing documents using the standard article class, with examples of common mathematical notation such as integral from zero to infinity of e to the power of minus x squared d x equals the square root of pi divided by two.

unnormalised: Dr. Rajesh Kumar, a professor at IIT Delhi and one of the workshop facilitators, emphasized the importance of LaTeX skills for engineering students. "In today's academic environment, proficiency in LaTeX is almost a necessity," he said. "Students who can effectively use LaTeX to present their work have a significant advantage in terms of clarity, professionalism, and impact." unnormalised: The online workshops will be conducted via Zoom, with each session lasting approximately 2 hours. Participants will have access to recorded sessions and supplementary materials after each workshop. The AICTE hopes that around 50000 students from various engineering colleges across India will benefit from this initiative. They are partnering with companies like TCS and Infosys to provide internship opportunities for those that excel in the course.
normalised: The online workshops will be conducted via Zoom, with each session lasting approximately two hours. Participants will have access to recorded sessions and supplementary materials after each workshop. The A-I-C-T-E hopes that around fifty thousand students from various engineering colleges across India will benefit from this initiative. They are partnering with companies like T-C-S and Infosys to provide internship opportunities for those that excel in the course.

unnormalised: AICTE Chairman, Prof. Anil Shastri, stated, "We are committed to providing engineering students with the skills and knowledge they need to succeed in their careers." This initiative is part of AICTE’s broader efforts to promote digital literacy and enhance the quality of technical education in India. Students can register for the workshops through the AICTE website, www.aicte-india.org, before the deadline. Successful completion of the workshop will grant them a certification that can be added to their resume for future opportunities.
